mph.connection

Class StudentManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • mph.connection.StudentManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ArtifactEditingFunctionalities, ArtifactViewerFunctionalities, BasicUserManagerInterface, CourseViewerFunctionalities, DeliverableViewerFunctionalities, ProjectViewerFunctionalities, StudentManagerRemote, TeamBasicFunctionalities, TeamCreationFunctionalities, TeamManagementFunctionalities, TeamViewerFunctionalities, UserEditingFunctionalities, UserLoginFunctionalities, UserRegisteringFunctionalities, UserSessionInterface, UserViewerFunctionalities

    public class StudentManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements StudentManagerRemote
    This class initializes the local interface of the Student and contains the methods of that interface, which are implemented by the Server.
    It implements StudentManagerRemote.

      • lookup

        private void lookup()
             throws javax.naming.NamingException
        It invokes ConnectionManager.setConnection() to try to set up a connection with the Server.
        Initialize the local student interface using Context.lookup(String)
        Throws:
        javax.naming.NamingException - if a connection error occurs during the lookup of the Server

      • login

        public void login(java.lang.String theUsername,
         java.lang.String thePassword)
           throws InvalidArgumentException,
                  AlreadyLoggedInException,
                  UserDoesNotExistException,
                  PasswordMismatchException,
                  javax.naming.NamingException
        Log in a student.
        It invokes lookup() to execute a lookup of the Server.
        It Invokes UserLoginFunctionalities.login(String, PasswordHashDTO).
        Parameters:
        theUsername - of the student
        thePassword - inserted by the student
        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentException - if a given argument is not valid
        AlreadyLoggedInException - if the student is already logged in
        UserDoesNotExistException - if the username given as parameter does not exist
        PasswordMismatchException - if the password given as parameter does not match with the one stored in the database
        javax.naming.NamingException - if a connection error occurs

      • login

        public void login(java.lang.String theUsername,
         PasswordHashDTO thePasswordHash)
           throws InvalidArgumentException,
                  AlreadyLoggedInException,
                  UserDoesNotExistException,
                  PasswordMismatchException
        Description copied from interface: UserLoginFunctionalities
        Log into the MPH system the user identified by the username given as parameter
        Specified by:
        login in interface UserLoginFunctionalities
        Parameters:
        theUsername - the username
        thePasswordHash - the hash of the user password
        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentException - if one of the arguments is not valid
        UserDoesNotExistException - if the username given as parameter is not registered into the system
        PasswordMismatchException - if the hash given as parameter does not match with the one saved into the database
        AlreadyLoggedInException

              throws UsernameAlreadyExistsException,
                     InvalidArgumentException,
                     javax.naming.NamingException
        Register a new student into the system.
        It invokes UserRegisteringFunctionalities.registerNewUser(String, PasswordHashDTO, String, String, Date, String, String)
        Parameters:
        theUsername - chosen by the student
        thePassword - chosen by the student
        theFirstName - of the new student
        theLastName - of the new student
        theBirthday - of the new student
        theEmail - of the new student
        theTelephoneNumber - of the new student

      • uploadArtifact

        public ArtifactIdDTO uploadArtifact(TeamIdDTO theTeamId,
                           DeliverableIdDTO deliverableId,
                           java.io.File theFile)
                             throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                    ForbiddenOperationException,
                                    UploadErrorException,
                                    InvalidArgumentException,
                                    UserNotLoggedInException,
                                    FileTooLargeException
        Upload an artifact into the system.
        It invokes ArtifactEditingFunctionalities.uploadArtifact(TeamIdDTO, DeliverableIdDTO, OutcomingFileDTO)
        Parameters:
        theTeamId - of the team uploading the artifact
        deliverableId - of the deliverable the artifact refers to
        theFile - the desired file to upload
        Returns:
        the id of the newly created artifact
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file given as parameter does not exist
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a given argument is not valid
        ForbiddenOperationException - if the student is not allowed to execute the operation
        UploadErrorException - if an error occurs during the upload
        InvalidArgumentException - if a given argument is not valid
        UserNotLoggedInException - if the student is not logged in
        FileTooLargeException - if the size of the file given as parameter is too large for the database

        UserNotLoggedInException - if the user is not logged in
